metadata.title: CVE-2023-22053 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component:Client programs). Supported versions that are affected are 5.7.42 and priorand 8.0.33 and prior. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows lowprivileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols tocompromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability canresult in unauthorized ability to cause a hang or frequently repeatablecrash (complete DOS) of MySQL Server and unauthorized read access to asubset of MySQL Server accessible data. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 5.9(Confidentiality and Availability impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:N/A:H).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-22053` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.43-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
mysql-client - 5.7.43-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.43-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.43-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
mysql-common - 5.7.43-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
mysql-server - 5.7.43-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.43-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.43-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.43-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.43-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.43-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.43-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1').
mariadb-10.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
percona-server-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
